definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The old lady has practised a lot at drawing and she is now a famous painter.
sentences.chinese: 这位老妇人刻苦练习绘画，她现在是一名著名画家了。

sentences.english: The valuable painting by a famous artist has been stayed up on the wall for many years.
sentences.chinese: 一位著名画家的珍贵油画已在墙上挂了许多年。

sentences.english: She had sat for famous painters like Rossetti.
sentences.chinese: 她为罗塞蒂等著名画家当过模特。

sentences.english: The picture was painted by a famous artist.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画是由一著名画家画的。

sentences.english: Rembrandt is a deservedly famous artist .
sentences.chinese: 伦勃朗是个当之无愧的名画家。

sentences.english: Helen: So, Gill gave us a run-down of the famous artists and their work on display here.
sentences.chinese: 很多各个历史时期著名画家的经典作品都收藏在这里。

sentences.english: Amy drew the most beautiful pictures and wanted to be a fa mous painter one day.
sentences.chinese: 艾米会画最漂亮的画，她希望有一天能成为名画家。

sentences.english: Is a famous painter of the 20th century, and calligraphy and seal.
sentences.chinese: 是我国20世纪著名画家和书法篆刻家。

sentences.english: Additionally, a vide variety of modern rugs are replicated from famous artist's paintings.
sentences.chinese: 此外，当天的地毯模仿各种现代著名画家的画作。

definition: authentic (painting or calligraphy)/genuine work (of famous artist)
Chang Dai-chien or Zhang Daqian (1899-1983), one of the greatest Chinese artists of the 20th century
Xu Beihong (1895-1953), famous European trained painter and influential art teacher
Shi Tao (1642-1707), Chinese landscape painter and poet
Huang Binhong (1865-1955), art historian and literati painter
